clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Botulinum Toxin Type A in Patients With Bladder Pain Syndrome/Intersticial Cystitis and Hunners' Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial for Efficacy of Botulinum Toxin Type A in Treatment of Patients Suffering Bladder Pain Syndrome/Interstitial Cystitis With Hunners' Lesions

lead_sponsor.agency: Moscow State University of Medicine and Dentistry

clinical_study.source: Moscow State University of Medicine and Dentistry

brief_summary.textblock:
The etiology of bladder pain syndrome is unknown. Therefore the management is directed to pain relief, as bladder pain is believed to drive both voiding frequency and nocturia. Botulinum toxin A has been shown to decrease noxious input. Several studies showed efficacy of botox for treatment of painful bladder.
The aim of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of Botulinum toxin in patients who are suffering bladder pain syndrome with Hunner lesions during cystoscopy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in pain intensity
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week followed by 1, 3, and 6 months after BoNTA injection
primary_outcome.description: Pain intensity is scored using a 10-point visual analog scale and change from baseline is observed

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of intensity of bladder bother symptoms
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 1 week, at 3 months and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: O'Leary-Sant score was used to assess symptoms and problems.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of quality of life
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 1 week, at 3 months and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Quality of life (QoL) was evaluated using question 8 of the International Prostate Symptoms Score.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 1 week, at 3months and 6 months after BoNTA injection
1 week, 3 months and 6 months after BoNTA injection

arm_group.description: Bladder intratrigonal injection of botulinum toxin (100 units) in 10 injection sites during cystoscopy under general anesthesia
cystoscopy with hydrodistension under general anesthesia

intervention.description: Bladder intratrigonal injection of botulinum toxin during cystoscopy under general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- longer than 6 months of bladder pain syndrome/interstitial cystitis with Hunner Lesion(s) during cystoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- neurologic diseases
- urinary tract infections
- bladder outlet obstruction
- previous pelvic radiotherapy
